clinical_study.brief_title: High Definition Endoscopy and Optic Enhancement Endoscopy in Gastric Neoplasia: A Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the diagnostic value of high definition endoscopy and optic enhancement in gastric neoplasia.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of optical enhancement endoscopy in diagnosis of gastric neoplasia
Specificity of optical enhancement endoscopy in diagnosis of gastric neoplasia
Positive predictive value of optical enhancement endoscopy in diagnosis of gastric neoplasia
Negative predictive value of optical enhancement endoscopy in diagnosis of gastric neoplasia

secondary_outcome.measure: The inter-observer and intra-observer agreement of optic enhancement endoscopy in gastric neoplasia

arm_group.arm_group_label: High definition endoscopy and optic enhancement
arm_group.description: All the patients underwent routine preparation before the procedure. The detected lesions in high definition endoscopy were observed with optic enhancement mode. The endoscopist was required to give the real-time descriptions of surface pit patterns of the lesions, based on surface pattern classification. After that, biopsy specimens will be obtained respectively by forceps from each detected lesion recorded for histologic diagnosis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with dyspeptic symptoms and aged 40 years or older, or with Helicobacter pylori infection, histologically verified gastric intestinal metaplasia or atrophic gastritis, or with family history of gastric cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with dyspeptic symptoms and aged 40 years or older
- or patients with Helicobacter pylori infection, or histologically verified gastric intestinal metaplasia or atrophic gastritis
- or patients with family history of gastric cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- presence of gastrectomy, acute gastrointestinal bleeding, or known gastric neoplasia
- presence of conditions unsuitable for endoscopy procedure including coagulopathy, impaired cardiopulmonary function , pregnancy or breastfeeding
- inability to provide informed consent
